CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo

CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo Struct Reference

#include <Apoxi/AddOns/CodecManager/CodecDevice.hpp>


Data Fields

UINT16 m_actual_height
UINT16 m_actual_width
UINT16 m_ext_height
UINT16 m_ext_width
UINT16 m_frame_rate_denominator
UINT16 m_frame_rate_numerator
INT m_left_offset
UINT32 m_max_bit_rate
UINT32 m_out_frame_length
CodecType m_stream_type
INT m_top_offset

Detailed Description

A struct containing information about encoded video stream.

Field Documentation

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_actual_height
 

Actual height of the compressed video frame.

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_actual_width
 

Actual width of the compressed video frame.

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_ext_height
 

Extended height of the compressed video frame (a multiple value of the MB height).

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_ext_width
 

Extended width of the compressed video frame (a multiple value of the MB width).

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_frame_rate_denominator
 

Denominator of the frame rate (in frames per second). The actual frame rate is calculated as m_frame_rate_numerator/m_frame_rate_denominator.

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_frame_rate_numerator
 

Numerator of the frame rate (in frames per second). The actual frame rate is calculated as m_frame_rate_numerator/m_frame_rate_denominator.

INT CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_left_offset
 

Left offset in the extended image from where the display image has to be obtained. It is only supported by some codecs (H.264). In order to disable cropping, this parameter and m_top_offset shall be set to 0.

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_max_bit_rate
 

Maximum bit rate (in bits/sec).If this info is not available this value is equal to 0.

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_out_frame_length
 

Video decoder output frame length (in bytes).

CodecType CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_stream_type
 

The encoding type (codec) of the compressed video stream.

INT CodecDevice::VideoStreamInfo::m_top_offset
 

Top offset in the extended image from where the display image has to be obtained. It is only supported by some codecs (H.264). In order to disable cropping, this parameter and m_left_offset shall be set to 0.
